# El Segundo | Vision 2050

## About El Segundo | Vision 2050

In March 2025, the City launched El Segundo | Vision 2050, a proactive long-term planning initiative to update the General Plan Land Use Element. Over the next 18-24 months, this page will be a resource for the latest information about El Segundo | Vision 2050 including:  

- Information about the General Plan and the Land Use Element
- Project schedule, including major milestones
- Public events, such as community meetings, workshops, and public hearings
- Drafts of plans, studies, and other documents produced during the update process
- The current and the proposed drafts of the new General Plan Land Use Element

## How Do I Get Involved in the Process?

[Click to subscribe](https://public.govdelivery.com/accounts/CAELSEGUNDO/subscriber/new?topic_id=CAELSEGUNDO_258)

The public can sign up for periodic emails about El Segundo | Vision 2050, including future events, community workshops, and public hearings. 

Please submit your questions or comments about El Segundo | Vision 2050 to Vision2050@elsegundo.org.

## Upcoming Events

**City Leadership Interviews - May 2025**

In late May 2025, the City will initiate its public outreach efforts with a series of interviews with City Council members and executive staff.

**Community Workshop - July 2025 (Exact date and location TBD)**

In July, the City will host the first public event for El Segundo | Vision 2050, a community workshop. During the workshop, City staff will present its initial existing conditions research and solicit public input about vision, goals and objectives for El Segundo | Vision 2050.

## Past Events

**Project Kick-off**
- On March 26, 2025, staff held a kick-off meeting with MIG, Inc. to launch El Segundo | Vision 2050, the City's effort to update the General Plan Land Use Element.  

**Contract Approval**
- On February 18, 2025, the City Council approved an agreement with planning consulting firm MIG, Inc. to assist the City with El Segundo | Vision 2050, the City's effort to update the General Plan Land Use Element.

## What is a General Plan & Its Land Use Element?

**What is a General Plan?**

A General Plan is a broad, long-range policy document that guides future development, conservation, and is a comprehensive collection of goals and policies related to a multitude of aspects of community life. In California, cities and counties are required by State law to have a General Plan. Generally, cities comprehensively update their general plans every 15 to 20 years.

A general plan is more than just a policy document - it reflects the vision, values, and priorities of a community. It defines what is unique and special that should be preserved and identifies strategic ways to improve a city's quality of life. Because a general plan impacts so many members of the community - residents, visitors, business owners, and more - the process of updating a general plan is a unique opportunity to come together as a community to develop a shared vision for the future.

**What is a General Plan Land Use Element?**

A General Plan Land Use Element is the long-term blueprint for the physical development of the City in both narrative and graphic terms. It contains broad goals, objectives, policies and programs, as well as more specific development criteria and standards, such as a map with the allowed distribution of land uses and a listing of maximum limits for building heights and development density.

## Why Update the General Plan Land Use Element?

The General Plan Land Use Element was last comprehensively updated when the overall General Plan was adopted in 1992.

The adopted Land Use Element had a time horizon of 15-20 years. However, over thirty years have passed since 1992 and most of the existing conditions at the time have changed significantly.

As a result, this year, the City initiated an effort to consult with the community and establish a new, enhanced vision.
